sections.text: Harvard Law School’s LL.M. is a one‑year degree for students from around the world to design a personalized course of study within parameters set by the HLS faculty.

items: Exposure to U.S. law and a substantial writing experience
Curricular planning within HLS faculty parameters
sections.text: Students complete 23–28 credits in one academic year and fulfill exposure to U.S. law and writing expectations while tailoring their studies.
